episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the rise of young Tetris champions, the use of cow urine in Indian government offices, a unique medical procedure involving a shin bone, and unusual baby names in Hawaii.

facts.fact: The world's best Tetris player is a 13-year-old from Texas, and the world's second-best player is his 15-year-old brother.
The Indian state of Madhya Pradesh has ruled that all government offices must be cleaned with cow urine.
In 2020, a woman in the UK received medical treatment in two different hospitals at the same time.
In 1990, five children in America were given the first name spelled A-B-C-D-E, or "absody."
